results.title: Out shopping
results.creator_credit: R.H.R. Productions, Ronald H. Riley and Eric Marquis
results.brief_description: Two housewives go out on a morning’s shopping. Newly married Mrs A does it unthinkingly; mature Mrs B with dkill. The two meet and Mrs A learns some useful tips. Consumer instructional film successfully using a comedy approach avoiding offence to put across the positive message that shopping must be done carefully.

results.title: Out on a limb
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Caroline Leaf and Erik Roberts
results.brief_description: Canadian independent filmmaker and animator Caroline Leaf is most recognised for the animated shorts she created for the National Film Board of Canada. To make her films she prefers alternative methods to the traditional “cell” animation, which she feels is devoid of emotion. “Out on a Limb” is a compilation of her works. In “The Owl Who Married a Goose” (producer, Pierre Moretti) she uses sand to create the the image. With “Entre Deaux Soeurs/Between Two Sisters” (producers, Robert Forget and Yves Leduc)she scratches emulsion from the film stock. In “The Street” (producer, Caroline Leaf), Leaf utilises waterbased tempera colours mixed with oil on milkglass as a medium. Her other films include “The Interview” (producer, David Verall), “I Met a Man” (producer, Caroline Leaf), “The Metamorphosis of Mr Samsa” (producer, Caroline Leaf) and “Hand Crafted Cinema” (producer and director, Erik Roberts), which is a filmed workshop where she talks about her work.

results.title: Out of wood (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Explores the close relationship between wood sculptor, Gay Hawkes with children of the Swan Hill North Primary School as she leads them towards the integration of the external world with the inner world of their imagination.

results.title: Out of true
results.creator_credit: J. Arthur Rank and Philip Leacock
results.brief_description: The story of Molly Slade, a housewife with two children, who has a complete nervous breakdown due to overstrain, and attempts to commit suicide.

results.title: Out of time out of place
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Rob McAuley and Bob Kingsbury
results.brief_description: This film examines the origins of the first Australians. In the 1970’s two discoveries of human fossil remains were made and evidence implied that two different types of people lived in Australia long before the emergence of the modern Aborigines. Dr. Alan Thorne, a key scientist in both finds, presents this program and explains where the first Australians came from.

results.title: Out of the past = Build my gallows high
results.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures, Warren B. Duff and Jacques Tourneur
results.brief_description: At the centre is the noir theme of a man’s destructive obsession with a femme fatale. The possibility of redemption is offered by the presence in a pastoral retreat of the safe, undemanding woman. The film’s special hallucinatory quality has its bases in Mitchum’s restrained playing and narration as the fated hero. Tourneur brings a downbeat, tragic other-worldliness to the complex flashback structure in which the past gradually overtakes the present. Photographer Nicholas Musuraca makes disconcerting use of deep shadow. Cast includes Robert Mitchum, Jane Greer, Kirk Douglas, Rhonda Fleming and Richard Webb. Based on the novel “Build my gallows high” by Geoffrey Homes.

results.title: Out of the mouths of babes (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Heather Cook
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Nature of things”.
Focuses on Peter and Jill de Villiers, two Harvard researchers, and their contention that knowledge of a language is innate in humans and develops as the child matures biologically. Includes interviews with both scientists and highlights their work. Suitable for tertiary/teacher level.

results.title: Out of the mouths (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Document Productions, Oral Hygiene Service and Bernice Rubens
results.brief_description: An unscripted film shot mainly in a Dorset primary school where an older pupil project on dental health is in progress. It includes discussion during a meeting of the parent/teacher association.
